means: [常用被动语态]（作为结果、情况）伴随

sentence.Network_en: He will be attending next week's American Grammy Awards in feverish anticipation.
sentence.Network_cn: 他将带着紧张兴奋的期待出席下周的美国格莱美奖颁奖。

sentence.Network_en: Most of those attending the funeral stood silently showing little emotion.
sentence.Network_cn: 出席葬礼的人大多都面无表情地静静站着。

sentence.Network_en: The dead included six people attending a religious ceremony.
sentence.Network_cn: 死者包括6位参加宗教仪式的人。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 贯注(attending)是心理咨询的首要条件之一。它要求心理咨询员在心理咨询过程中全神贯注地聆听当事人讲话，认真观察其细微的情绪 …
attending responsibility reform based on definition on right ., 基于权利界定的主诊医师负责制改革.
...医生(resident)、住院总(fellow)、主治(attending)和主任(chief)，医生之间竞争非常激烈，特别在罗德岛医院这样的州立医院，住院医 …
she has been attending on her sick mother for years ., 她侍候生病的母亲已经许多年了.

list.abs: 关于职业的英语单词_百度文库 ... astronaut: 宇航员. attendant: 服务员 auditor: 审计员.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... attend v 出席；看护 attendant a 出席的 n.随从 attention n 注意力.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... temptatious a 诱惑性的 284 attend v 出席；看护 attendant a 出席的 n.随从.
高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... positive adj 肯定的；积极的 attend vt 出席；！参加；上（大学等） △ rehearse vt 预演；排演.
英语词汇的奥秘 ... resistance 抵抗 attendance 出席，到场 expectance 期待，期望.
niki-study blog - niki-study - 网易博客 ... 1.appointment 约会，约定 2.attendance 出席人数；出席 3.cabinet 橱柜.

entry.def: If you attend a meeting or other event, you are present at it.

example.ex: Thousands of people attended the funeral...
The meeting will be attended by finance ministers from many countries...
example.tran: 很多国家的财政部长将出席会议。

entry.def: If you attend an institution such as a school, college, or church, you go there regularly.

example.ex: They attended college together at the University of Pennsylvania.
example.tran: 他们一起就读于宾夕法尼亚大学。

entry.tran: 处理，料理（事情）；照顾，护理（受伤的人）
entry.def: If you attend to something, you deal with it. If you attend to someone who is hurt or injured, you care for them.

example.ex: The staff will helpfully attend to your needs...
example.tran: 工作人员会帮忙满足您的需求。

example.ex: There are more pressing matters to be attended to today...
example.tran: 今天有更紧急的事情要处理。

means.word_mean: 1. the process whereby a person concentrates on some features of the environment to the (relative) exclusion of others
2. the act of being present (at a meeting or event etc.)
1. being present at meeting or event

auth_sentence.content: Secretary of State Hillary Clinton is attending the forum.
auth_sentence.res_content: Secretary of State Hillary Clinton is attending the forum.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Secretary of State Hillary Clinton is attending the forum.

auth_sentence.content: He says he does not regret attending the demonstration.
auth_sentence.res_content: He says he does not regret attending the demonstration.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He says he does not regret attending the demonstration.

auth_sentence.content: I was too busy attending to my half-baked plan.
auth_sentence.res_content: I was too busy attending to my half-baked plan.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I was too busy attending to my half-baked plan.

Sentence.sentence: To enhance his credibility with the audience, Larry had brought some slides of his family attending sports events.
He will be attending a meeting

In 2008 the net cost of attending a four-year public university – after financial aid – equaled 28% of median (中间的) family income, while a four-year private university cost 76% of median family income.
